intro: Isotropis cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed isotropis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a distinct cuneate base, contributing to its common name. Isotropis cuneifolia is often found in montane habitats and is adapted to cool, humid climates.
